results.title: Ice birds
results.creator_credit: Marc Beaudet, ONF | NFB and Marc Hebert
results.brief_description: Crystal Pillar, White Lady, The Whale—these are the names given by ice-climbing enthusiasts to the spectacular ice formations surrounding Quebec’s Montmorency Falls. Ice Birds shows two experienced climbers scaling the breathtaking wall of the Crystal Pillar with precision and considerable daring, appearing from below as black spots on the vast landscape of one of nature’s masterpieces. Film without words

results.title: Ice and water: a case study
results.creator_credit: Andrew Millington, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: A case study of the ice/water system. Considers: the two properties of the ice/water system, the odd density variation with temperature and the fact that ice melts at zero degrees centigrade when subject to a high pressure. (Solids, liquids and gases series; unit 16)
results.description: A case study of the ice/water system. Considers: the two properties of the ice/water system, the odd density variation with temperature and the fact that ice melts at zero degrees centigrade when subject to a high pressure. (Solids, liquids and gases series; unit 16)

results.title: Icarus = Icare (K)
results.creator_credit: Wolf Koenig, ONF | NFB and Paul Bochner
results.brief_description: The Greek myth retold by film animation, accompanied by music for flute written by Eldon Rathburn. Music, drawing, colour and movement here follow a moving classic restraint. Daedalus, inventor of many things, provides the wings to escape from Crete but Icarus, his son, impetuously flies too high. In this film, artist and composer share equal pleasure in the telling, with a feeling the audience will share. A film without words. Award: Oberhausen
results.creator_credit_for_label: Wolf Koenig, ONF | NFB and Paul Bochner

results.title: IC - a shrinking world
results.creator_credit: John Rimo, Bell Telephone Laboratories and Henry R. Feinberg
results.brief_description: Uses animation and color photography - much of it shot through a microscope to convey the story of integrated circuits, electronic circuits smaller than a grain of salt.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Rimo, Bell Telephone Laboratories and Henry R. Feinberg

results.title: Iberian Peninsula: Spain and Portugal
results.brief_description: A brief survey of modern Spain and Portugal showing the chief topographic and climatic features of th Peninsula, and portraying people at work in various types of agricultural pursuits and in fishing, mining and industry. Emphasises especially the Peninsula’s limited industrialisation and the age-old agricultural techniques generally employed in the region.
results.description: A brief survey of modern Spain and Portugal showing the chief topographic and climatic features of th Peninsula, and portraying people at work in various types of agricultural pursuits and in fishing, mining and industry. results.title: Ian's case (Captioned)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Peter Quarry introduces a 3 step process for discussing poor work performance with staff. Discusses real life examples of common mistakes together with the correct way to counsel staff.
results.description:

results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Ian's case
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Improving Performance”.
Ian works in an art department. His work has become sloppy, he makes long personal phone calls, he drinks and he is constantly late or off work. His supervisor, Hugo, has spoken to him twice previously and now adopts the hard approach. Peter Quarry then assumes the role of supervisor and uses the 3 step approach.

results.title: I.S.O. inter-laboratory apparel flammability trials
results.brief_description: A record of flammability trials carried out by the CSIRO Division of Protein Chemistry in collaboration with the Standards Association of Australia. The fabrics tested covered a spectrum of flammability characteristics and consisted of natural and synthetic fibres and blends of these.
results.description: A record of flammability trials carried out by the CSIRO Division of Protein Chemistry in collaboration with the Standards Association of Australia. results.title: I.L.O. (International Labour Organization)
results.brief_description: The film shows how the International Labour Organization, established in 1919, continues to bring together the representatives of forty-six member nations to set uniform standards of social welfare for the working people of the world. The carrying out of the policies in mines, mills and merchant shipping from Montreal to Shanghai demonstrates the practicality of international legislation.
